snippet: After hundreds of homes were razed in Black Forest, Colo., officials are examining what can be done to curb the destruction caused by wildfires.
abstract: Residents and officials of Black Forest, Colo, raise questions about whether faster responses or tighter fire regulations could have done anything to curb path of the most destructive wildfire in Colorado's history; blaze has now burned 400 homes, killed two people and spread across 15,000 acres.
lead_paragraph: After hundreds of homes were razed in Black Forest, Colo., officials are examining what can be done to curb the destruction caused by wildfires.

headline.main: In Colorado, Nature Takes a Fiery Toll Despite a Community’s Efforts to Prepare
headline.print_headline: In Colorado, Nature Takes a Fiery Toll Despite a Community’s Efforts to Prepare
